item.title: Report X-2024100257
item.description:
Report X-2024100257

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-05T09:31:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-02
  • City: BRADENTON
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: JT Foley Service Center Manager at 226 called safety to report a spill in trailer 554975, UN1760, CORROSIVE LIQUIDS, N.O.S.(CONTAINS HYDROCHLORIC ACID), 8, PGll. JT stated the pallet looks to have become unstable and fell over during transit causing a one 5 gallon pail to become damaged on the botto m of the pallet. JT stated the damaged pail looks to have been crushed causing a spill of 64oz of the UN1760, CORROSIVE LIQUIDS, N.O.S on the trailer floor. JT stated one of the dock workers started to re stack the pallet on a new skid and JT advised he told the dock worker to stop work and he was g oing to call the spill into safety. JT stated the spill was made possible from improper blocking embracing.~

item.title: Report E-2024100128
item.description:
Report E-2024100128

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-05T09:31:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-22
  • City: TAMPA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CIRCLE K
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 25000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 500-gallons of gasoline released from one (1) tanker truck due to the driver attempting to switch trailers, but the weight was too heavy, causing the landing gear to go through the bottom of the trailer and the tank fell on the ground. The release impacted the asphalt parking lot and ditch that is in the center of the parking lot. Emergency response contractor HEPACO arrived on site and performed an initial clean up and collected an estimated 11,000 gallons of Liquid waste from the ditch and placed it into a frac-tank. The soil ditch area is pending remediation. No storm drains were reported impacted by the release.
